timeline.message:
Verifying multi-entity detectors

This PR adds categorical fields' number and length check. We only support one categorical field, and the categorical field can only be of type keyword and ip.  We also limit the max multi-entity detectors to 10.

Testing done:
1. added unit tests
2. did manual testing.

timeline.author: ylwu-amzn

timeline.bodyText:
1 is magic number, how about we create CATEGORY_FIELD_LIMIT instant and use it at all other places. like IndexAnomalyDetectorActionHandler.java line 269:
if (categoryField.size() != 1) {
timeline.author: ylwu-amzn

timeline.bodyText: minor: if we plan to support multiple category fields, should we name this as "categoryFields" ?
timeline.author: ylwu-amzn

timeline.bodyText: I see we just use 1 category field today, do we see possible use cases of multiple category fields ?
timeline.author: saratvemulapalli

timeline.bodyText: Do we plan to write HC detector's result into another index?
timeline.author: ylwu-amzn

replies.bodyText: not in the plan.  The code would have to change a lot for that to happen.  e.g., depends on there is categorical field or not, job scheduler will save to different places.  Right now, job scheduler does not have access to AnomalyDetector object.
replies.author: kaituo

replies.bodyText: Got it, how about remove the "single-entity" from the comments?
replies.author: ylwu-amzn

timeline.bodyText: Should we change to "category_fields" ? Same question for line 113, 130, and other places. Suggest to replace by searching all files.
timeline.author: ylwu-amzn

replies.bodyText: Can we do it later?  Both Yizhe and I need to change for this.
replies.author: kaituo

replies.bodyText: Thanks so much for your consideration.
replies.author: kaituo
